@template access

{{html:
<div class="account-container stacked upMargin" ng-app="cloudscalers" ng-controller="SessionController">
    <div class="content clearfix padding"  ng-controller="SignUpController">
        <div class="login-symbol signUpForm">
        <h1>Sign Up</h1>

        <div class="login-fields">
            <form name="reg" ng-submit="signUp()"> <!-- name should be "reg" for some browsers to recognize it as a registration form -->
                <div class="alert alert-error ng-hide" ng-show="!isPasswordConfirmed">The passwords do not match.</div>
                <div class="alert alert-error ng-hide" ng-show="signUpError">{[signUpError]}</div>
                <div class="field">
                  <div class="loginField">
                    <label class="loginFieldName loginFieldName2" for="username">Username:</label>
                    <div class="inputWrap">
  						
                    	<input style="background-color: transparent !important; background-attachment: none !important; background-image: none !important; position: relative; font-size: 20px; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 20px;" class="inputLogin ng-pristine ng-valid" type="text" id="username" name="username" value=""  ng-model="user.username" />
					       </div>
                </div>
                </div>
          <div class="field">
          <div class="loginField">
                    <label class="loginFieldName loginFieldName2" for="username">Email address:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						      <div class="inputWrap">
                    	<input class="inputLogin ng-pristine ng-valid" type="text" id="email" value=""  ng-model="email" />
                      <input style="display: none;" type="text" id="username" value=""  ng-model="user.username" />
                      </div>
 					        </div>
                  </div>
           </div>

                <div class="field" style="display: none;">
                <div class="loginField">
                    <label class="loginFieldName loginFieldName2" for="password">Password:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						<div class="inputWrap">
                      <input class="inputLogin ng-pristine ng-valid" type="password" id="password_field" name="" value=""  ng-model="user.password"/>
                      </div>
                   	</div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                <div class="field" style="display: none;">
                <div class="loginField">
                    <label class="loginFieldName loginFieldName2" for="password">Password Confirmation:</label>
                    <div class="input-prepend">
  						<div class="inputWrap">
                      <input class="inputLogin ng-pristine ng-valid" type="password" id="password_field_confirmation" name="password_confirmation" value="" 
                        	ng-model="passwordConfirmation" ng-blur="validatePasswordConfirmation()"/>
                          </div>
                   	</div>
                </div>
                </div>
            <!-- <a ng-click="openTerms()">Terms</a> -->
            <script type="text/ng-template" id="termsDialog.html">
                <div class="modal-header">
                    <h2>Terms</h2>
                </div>
                <div class="modal-body">
                  <p>
                  Please note that this is a beta version of the MOTHERSHIP1 website which is still undergoing final testing before its official release.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                  The website, its software and all content found on it are provided on an “as is” and “as available” basis.
                  </p>
                  <p>MOTHERSHIP1does not give any warranties, whether express or implied, as to the suitability or usability of the website, its software or any of its content.
                  </p>
                  <p>MOTHERSHIP1 will not be liable for any loss, whether such loss is direct, indirect, special or consequential, suffered by any party as a result of their use of the MOTHERSHIP1 website, its software or content. Any downloading or uploading of material to the website is done at the user’s own risk and the user will be solely responsible for any damage to any computer system or loss of data that results from such activities. 
                  </p>
                  <p>
                  Should you encounter any bugs, glitches, lack of functionality or other problems on the website, please let us know immediately so we can rectify these accordingly. Your help in this regard is greatly appreciated.
                  </p>
                  <input id="accept-terms" type="checkbox" name="vehicle">
                  <label for="accept-terms">I have a bike</label>
                </div>
                <div class="modal-footer">
                    <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary ok" ng-click="cancel()">Ok</button>
                </div>
            </script>
            </div>
              <input class="btn btn-primary btn-lg btn-block primaryMine"  type="submit" ng-disabled="!canSignUp" value="Sign Up" />

              <div class="center txt-right mtm mTxt">
          <span class="mrs">Already a member?</span>
          <a href="/$$space/login" class="btn btn-default btn-lg btn-block defaultMine">Login</a>
        </div>
            
        </form>

        </div>
    </div>
</div>
        

}}
